faq.question: Why Filterizr?
faq.answer: Filterizr is fast, responsive, performs well on mobile and is written with up-to-date JavaScript. It has no dependencies and can be used either as a vanilla JavaScript library, a jQuery plugin and soon as a React component.

faq.question: Can I redistribute, sell or alter Filterizr?
faq.answer: Yes, Filterizr is licensed under MIT. This means you can do whatever you please with it.

faq.question: How can I contribute to Filterizr?
faq.answer: If you would like to help build Filterizr into something better, you can find its GitHub repo right here. If you used Filterizr I would appreciate if you could starthe repo on GitHub.

caveats.question: How can I use margins?
caveats.answer: There are two options to use margins. Either make use of the gutterPixels option, or create wrapper elements and set paddings on them. What's important is that the items amount to a total of 100% width.

caveats.question: The CSS for my filtering has bad performance
caveats.answer: If the performance of your Filterizr's effect is not silky smooth, please make sure to read on compositor-only properties as well as hardware-accelerated CSS and go through your code again.
